subject: p18309149
History: History: M with cough, DOE, left lower diminished BS and rales, no signs of CHF, Please evaluate for consolidation, effusion, or pulmonary edema.
Findings: The left lung is clear. There is stable elevation of the right hemidiaphragm. Mild atelectasis is noted in the right lung base along with basilar scarring, causing patchy opacity in the right lung base, better assessed on prior CT torso from. The heart size is normal. No pulmonary edema, pleural effusion, or pneumothorax.
Impression: Atelectasis and scarring is noted at the right lung base, better assessed on prior CTA torso from. Otherwise, no acute cardiopulmonary process.
